text: many in East Aleppo including children
waited outside yesterday in freezing
conditions hoping the buses would take
them away from the hellish conditions of
this the remnants of the rebel
stronghold but it was only in the early
hours this morning that finally the
evacuations resumed after a new deal was
struck between the warring factions
already today more than four thousand
people have got out for these families
huge relief medicine and food now
available amongst them was this
seven-year-old girl
Barna a Lebed whose flight has been
followed by hundreds of thousands of
people around the world helped by her
family
she wrote a series of tweets begging for
a ceasefire and describing the terror of
the incessant bombing around her home
she feared they would all be killed
we enjoyed endless bombardment in Aleppo
we have managed to escape the
destruction because our house was
reduced to rubble I would like to say
thank you to all those who had been
asking about our news also able to
escape today was this group of 47
orphans who had been trapped by the
fighting some critically injured they
too had used the Internet to make a
last-ditch appeal for help this video
going viral please let us evacuate
Aleppo we wish to leave Aleppo so we can
eat and drink we love peace but it's not
just the people of East Aleppo who have
been taken to safety today these buses
are carrying hundreds of villagers
who've been surrounded by rebel fighters
in a nearby province of Idlib allowing
these people to escape was a key part of
the agreements reached at the weekend
other people were difficult disagreement
is a humanitarian one those evacuated
include injured or sick individuals as
well as elderly people from the villages
of of alpha and calf area today there's
hope that most of the civilians caught
up in the fighting here will reach
safety but many thousands more wait to
be evacuated and the ceasefire is very
fragile
Richard Galpin BBC news
